intro: Blepharis saturejifolia, commonly known as the woolly bladderflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal areas and has adapted to arid conditions. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in its native habitat.
